head.title: April 30-May 6; An 'I Love You' Virus Becomes Anything But

hedline.hl1: April 30-May 6; An 'I Love You' Virus Becomes Anything But

block.p: A rogue software program, borne by an e-mail message proclaiming ''I love you,'' propelled itself around the world, jamming and crashing e-mail systems and destroying data on millions of computers.
A rogue software program, borne by an e-mail message proclaiming ''I love you,'' propelled itself around the world, jamming and crashing e-mail systems and destroying data on millions of computers.

Known as a ''worm,'' the program may have been launched in the Philippines, and it left angry computer users cautiously opening their electronic mail. The White House, the Pentagon, Congress and the British House of Commons were among the victims of the program that swept through many nations' computer networks in less than a day.
